Class HexTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • HexTest

  • public class HexTest
extends java.lang.Object
    This JUnit tests the Hex class. If you have coded it correctly they should all pass! This is not an exhaustive test - you can create your own test cases.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HexTest() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void HexGameInvalidMoveTest()
      This test checks that the current player is not changed if an invalid move is attempted.
      void HexGamePlayer1WinTest()
      This test checks a player 2 win scenario This test was changed by me to take into account the method of coordinates to be [row][col].
      void HexGamePlayer2WinTest()
      This test checks a player 2 win scenario.
      void HexInitialisationTest()
      This test checks the initial creation of a Hex class.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • HexInitialisationTest

        public void HexInitialisationTest()
        This test checks the initial creation of a Hex class.

      • HexGamePlayer1WinTest

        public void HexGamePlayer1WinTest()
        This test checks a player 2 win scenario This test was changed by me to take into account the method of coordinates to be [row][col]. In this case, player 2 tries to connect the top to the bottom(Yellow edges in image in specification)

      • HexGamePlayer2WinTest

        public void HexGamePlayer2WinTest()
        This test checks a player 2 win scenario. This test was changed by me to take into account the method of coordinates to be [row][col]. In this case, player 2 tries to connect the left and right sides(Yellow edges in board in specification)

      • HexGameInvalidMoveTest

        public void HexGameInvalidMoveTest()
        This test checks that the current player is not changed if an invalid move is attempted.
